_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This Risk Management Plan (RMP) has been developed for the New Bedford Facility of Allegheny Rodney located at 1357 East Rodney French Boulevard, New Bedford, Massachusettes, and is pursuant to the requirements of 40 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 68.  Forms available with the RMP Submit Software developed for the U.S. Environemental Protection Agency (US EPA) have been completed for this facility.  These forms contain the information necessary for the RMP submittal and are included in Appendix A of the Facility's RMP Plan.

Process Description and Regulated Substances
The New Bedford Facility has designed and operates a process for the storage and transfer of 70 percent hydrofluoric acid (HF) into process tubs.  This process includes 55-gallon drums located in an acid storage area and piping used to supply 70 percent HF to the process tubs.  This process is located in a parts of the plant that are designed for the handling and use of hydrofluoric acid.  The storage, handling, and use of 70 percent HF at the plant is hereafter referred to as "the process" in the remainder of this document.  The North American Industrial Classification System code for the facility is 331111.  The New Bedford Facility process is classified as a Tier II program since the facility is not subject to Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) requirements pursuant to 29 CFR 1910.119. 

Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
The New Bedford Facility has an excellent record in preventing and minimizing releases of HF.  The New Bedford Facility remains committed to the prevention of releases of HF.  In the event of a release, the New Bedford Facility is committed to a timely response in accordance with their Preparedness, Prevention, and Contingency (PPC) Plan and the applicable components of this RMP.  Accident prevention and emergency response programs are described in this RMP.  

General Accidental Release Prevention

Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
The New Bedford Facility has safe job procedures (SJP) in place:

· to evaluate the HF storage area capacity and volume already in place before unloading begins;
· to describe the use of HF in the facility's manufacturing operations; and
· for the inspection of all process equipment including the HF drums, piping, and isolation valves.

In addition, the New Bedford Facility trains employees regarding safe job procedures, safe work practices, emergency evacuation and response, and routine and nonroutine work authorization.  Finally, the New Bedford Facility maintains the ongoing mechanical integrity of the process equipment.

Five-Year Accident History
There have been no accidental releases associated with this process in the last 5 years that have resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

Emergency Response Program
The New Bedford Facility maintains a PPC Plan/Spill Prevention Response (SPR) Plan. The New Bedford Facility has trained employees for an initial response team.  This team will don personal protective equipment (PPE) and be dispatched to control or stop a minor emergency or an accidental release or help move any employee(s) that has been affected by a 70 percent HF release.  If necessary, employees will be evacuated to a safe zone.

In the event of an emergency where off-site response is appropriate, it will be the policy of the New Bedford Facility to notify the New Bedford Fire Department and/or the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and request that they respond to the emergency.  A fire, explosion, or other occurrence with the potential to create a release of the regulated substance (HF) from the process may pose a danger to public emergency responders. Public emergency responders will not be permitted to enter this area except as previously arranged with the

Primary Emergency Coordinator (PEC) or other designated personnel as identified within this RMP.

Finally, the New Bedford Facility has an equipped emergency control center.  The emergency control center will be sited in a safe zone and will serve as the major communication link between the PEC and plant or corporate management as well as with local community officials.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety
No additional measures to prevent off-site impacts from accidental releases have been identified or are required at this time.  If reasonable measures are subsequently identified that would lower the risk of an off-site release, such measures will be implemented.

Responsible Person
I, Deborah L. Calderazzo, Director of Environmental Affairs, have been assigned as the qualified person with the overall responsibility for the development, implementation, and integration of the RMP and subsequent program elements for New Bedford Facility of Allegheny Rodney.

Currently, I have the responsibility for implementing the individual requirements of this RMP.  Should this responsibility be assigned to another person (or persons) other than myself, the names and positions of these people will be documented and the lines of authority will be defined through an organization chart or similar document. 

I certify that, to the best of my knowledge, information, and belief, formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted here is true, accurate, and complete.
